00006 #include "maven.h"

00023 bool registerVariable(MavenCompiler* c, StringList tokens, bool compiling, MavenVariable& v) {
00024         // if we are mapping and in the localScope, let the compiler deal with this
00025         if(!compiling && c->currentFunction != "")
00026                 return true;
00027         
00028         // the easiest and safest way to handle this, is to run this function
00029         // a few times:
00030         // int a = 1, b = 2;
00031         int reserved = 0;
00032         for(; reserved < tokens.length(); ++reserved) {
00033                 if(!isKeyword(c, tokens[reserved]) && !objectExists(c, tokens[reserved]) &&
00034                    !enumExists(c, tokens[reserved])) break;
00035         }
00036         
00037         // count how many variables we are actually registering?
00038         StringList separate = splitCommas(tokens.join(" ", reserved, tokens.length() - 1));
00039         MavenVariable var;
00040         if(separate.length() > 1) {
00041                 for(int i = 0; i < separate.length(); ++i) {
00042                         var.reset();
00043                         if(!registerVariable(c, smartTokens(tokens.join(" ", 0, reserved - 1) + " " + separate[i]), compiling, var))
00044                                 return false;
00045                 }
00046                 return true;
00047         }
00048         
00049         // proceed with single registration
00050         if(tokens.length() == 1) {
00051                 pushError(c, "Incomplete type, expected variable name");
00052                 return false;
00053         }
00054         
00055         // process tokens
00056         bool setDefault = true;
00057         bool isEnum = false;
00058         for(int i = 0; i < tokens.length() - 1; ++i) {
00059                 if(tokens[i] == "external") v.isExternal = true;
00060                 else if(tokens[i] == "public") v.isPublic = true;
00061                 else if(tokens[i] == "private") v.isPublic = false;
00062                 else if(tokens[i] == "static") v.isStatic = true;
00063                 else if(tokens[i] == "constant") v.mutability = MU_CONSTANT;
00064                 else if(isDataType(stripRawType(tokens[i])) || objectExists(c, stripRawType(tokens[i])))
00065                         v.type = findMavenObjectPath(c, tokens[i]);
00066                 else if(enumExists(c, stripRawType(tokens[i]))) {
00067                         v.type = findMavenEnumPath(c, tokens[i]);
00068                         isEnum = true;
00069                 } else {
00070                         if(tokens[i + 1] == "=") {
00071                                 setDefault = false;
00072                                 v.name = tokens[i];
00073                                 
00074                                 // move the array depth from the variable name to the type
00075                                 int depth = getArrayDepth(v.name);
00076                                 v.name = stripRawType(v.name);
00077                                 for(int j = 0; j < depth; ++j)
00078                                         v.type += "[]";
00079                                 
00080                                 StringList vtype;
00081                                 MavenMutability m;
00082                                 v.defaultValue = dissectCode(c, tokens.join(" ", i + 2, tokens.length() - 1), vtype, m, false);
00083                                 if(!canCastBetween(c, vtype.join(","), v.type, false, compiling))
00084                                         pushError(c, "Can't cast %s to %s", vtype.join(","), v.type);
00085                                 
00086                                 if(compiling && c->beforeLine != "")
00087                                         writeAutoCPPLine(c, c->beforeLine);
00088                                 c->beforeLine = "";
00089                                 
00090                                 // move default value to main()
00091                                 if(c->currentFunction == "") {
00092                                         if(compiling) {
00093                                                 
00094                                                 // post check for all the objects
00095                                                 if(c->objectCheck.size() > 0) {
00096                                                         for(int i = 0; i < c->objectCheck.size(); ++i)
00097                                                                 pushEntryLine(c, "if(" + c->objectCheck[i].key + ") { " + c->objectCheck[i].value + " }");
00098                                                         c->objectCheck.clear();
00099                                                 }
00100                                                 
00101                                                 pushEntryLine(c, c->currentNamespace + "::" + c->currentClass + "$static::" + v.name + " = " + v.defaultValue + ";");
00102                                         }
00103                                         v.defaultValue = "";
00104                                 }
00105                                 
00106                                 break;
00107                         } else pushError(c, "Unexpected token '%s'", tokens[i]);
00108                 }
00109         }
00110         if(v.name == "")
00111                 v.name = tokens[tokens.length() - 1];
00112         v.atLine = c->lineNumber;
00113         v.doc = filterDoc(c, c->doc);
00114         c->doc = "";
00115         
00116         // if the variable name contains '[]' set it as an array
00117         if(v.name.find("[]") != string::npos) {
00118                 v.name = v.name.substr(0, v.name.find("[]"));
00119                 v.type += "[]";
00120         }
00121         
00122         // set the default value
00123         if(c->currentFunction == "" && c->currentClass == MAVEN_BARE_CLASS && compiling && setDefault) {
00124                 string defval = "0";
00125                 if(isEnum) {
00126                         int nid = findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace);
00127                         int enumid = findEnumID(c, nid, v.type);
00128                         for(int i = 0; i < c->namespaces->at(nid).enums[enumid].items.size(); ++i) {
00129                                 if(c->namespaces->at(nid).enums[enumid].items[i].isDefault) {
00130                                         defval = intToString(c->namespaces->at(nid).enums[enumid].items[i].value);
00131                                         break;
00132                                 }
00133                         }
00134                 }
00135                 pushEntryLine(c, c->currentNamespace + "::" + c->currentClass + "$static::" + v.name + " = " + defval + ";");
00136         }
00137         
00138         // move the array depth from the variable name to the type
00139         int depth = getArrayDepth(v.name);
00140         v.name = stripRawType(v.name);
00141         for(int i = 0; i < depth; ++i)
00142                 v.type += "[]";
00143         
00144         // validate name
00145         if(!validEntityName(v.name))
00146                 pushError(c, "Invalid entity name '%s'", v.name);
00147         
00148         int namespaceID = findNamespaceID(c, c->currentNamespace);
00149         int objectID = findObjectID(c, namespaceID, c->currentClass);
00150         
00151         // need these to proceed
00152         smartAssert(namespaceID >= 0);
00153         smartAssert(objectID >= 0);
00154         
00155         if(compiling && c->currentFunction != "") {
00156                 // bug #52: make sure this is the first time it's being registered
00157                 pushLocalScope(c, v);
00158                 
00159                 if(depth == 0) {
00160                         // bug #51: defval needs to match type
00161                         if(trim(v.defaultValue) == "")
00162                                 v.defaultValue = "0";
00163                         writeAutoCPPLine(c, v.getCPP(c) + " = " + v.defaultValue + ";");
00164                 } else writeAutoCPPLine(c, "maven::objectArray* " + v.name + ";");
00165         } else if(!compiling && c->currentFunction == "") {
00166                 // if the variable is truly bare, it's static
00167                 if(c->currentClass == MAVEN_BARE_CLASS)
00168                         v.isStatic = true;
00169                 
00170                 // make sure this is the first time it's being registered
00171                 
00172                 /*for(int i = 0; i < c->namespaces[namespaceID].objects[objectID].variables.length(); ++i) {
00173                         if(c->namespaces[namespaceID].objects[objectID].variables[i].name == v.name) {
00174                                 cout << "Registering '" << c->namespaces[namespaceID].objects[objectID].variables[i].name
00175                                          << "' Looking in '" << c->namespaces[namespaceID].objects[objectID].name << "'\n";
00176                                 if(c->namespaces[namespaceID].objects[objectID].variables[i].isInherited)
00177                                         pushError(c, "You can not override inherited variable %s", v.name);
00178                                 else pushError(c, "Duplicate variable '%s', previously defined at line %s", v.name, intToString(c->namespaces[namespaceID].objects[objectID].variables[i].atLine));
00179                                 return false;
00180                         }
00181                  }*/
00182                 
00183                 pushVariable(c, namespaceID, objectID, v);
00184                 if(c->currentClass == MAVEN_BARE_CLASS && tokens.length() > 2) {
00185                         string newline = "";
00186                         for(int i = 1; i < tokens.length(); ++i)
00187                                 newline += tokens[i] + " ";
00188                 }
00189         }
00190         
00191         return true;
00192 }
